revised_title: The Role of Blood Corpuscles in Organ Formation and Tissue Development
tldr: The author, Martin Barry, studied the blood corpuscles and their role in the formation and nourishment of organs. He discovered that blood corpuscles can transform into cells that form the chorion and muscular fibers. This research supports the theories of Schwann and provides evidence of the diverse roles blood corpuscles play in tissue development.
